com.engineersbox.httpproxy.connection.socket

Class SingletonSocketFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.net.SocketFactory
      • com.engineersbox.httpproxy.connection.socket.SingletonSocketFactory

  • public class SingletonSocketFactory
extends javax.net.SocketFactory
    Factory to create Socket based on Connections which are optionally set. The default Connections configuration used is:
    • Acceptor queue size: 10
    • Handler queue size: 10
    • Drop after: 0
    • Drop on failed DNS lookup: false
    • Read buffer size: 1024
    A custom Connections configuration can be supplied via the withSocketConfigs(com.engineersbox.httpproxy.configuration.domain.servlet.Connections) method.

      Creates a Socket with a binding to the supplied host and port, additionally supplies the localhost and localport parameters to bind the socket to a local configuration.

      • createSocket

        public java.net.Socket createSocket(java.lang.String host,
                                    int port)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a Socket with a binding to the supplied host and port.

        Additionally sets the SocketOptions.SO_TIMEOUT and SocketOptions.SO_RCVBUF options based on the set connectionsConfig.
        Specified by:
        createSocket in class javax.net.SocketFactory
        Parameters:
        host - the host name, or null for the loopback address.
        port - the port number.
        Returns:
        ServerSocket
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O exception occurs whilst opening the socket

        See Also:
        Socket.Socket(String, int)

      • createSocket

        public java.net.Socket createSocket(java.lang.String host,
                                    int port,
                                    java.net.InetAddress localhost,
                                    int localport)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a Socket with a binding to the supplied host and port, additionally supplies the localhost and localport parameters to bind the socket to a local configuration.

        Additionally sets the SocketOptions.SO_TIMEOUT and SocketOptions.SO_RCVBUF options based on the set connectionsConfig.
        Specified by:
        createSocket in class javax.net.SocketFactory
        Parameters:
        host - the name of the remote host, or null for the loopback address.
        port - the remote port
        localhost - the local address the socket is bound to, or null for the anyLocal address.
        localport - the local port the socket is bound to, or zero for a system selected free port.
        Returns:
        ServerSocket
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O exception occurs whilst opening the socket

        See Also:
        Socket.Socket(String, int, InetAddress, int)
